byline.original: By TAMAR LEWIN and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

abstract: College and universities across country are bracing for consequences of Supreme Court's decision in reconsidering challenge to affirmative action at University of Texas at Austin by Abigail Fisher, white woman who was denied admission; advocates for affirmative action are worried that decision to revisit case indicates court is prepared to strike down race-based admissions.
lead_paragraph: After the Supreme Court said it would revisit an affirmative action case from Texas, colleges expressed concerns about the potential costs of having to replace programs to achieve diversity.

headline.main: Colleges Brace for Supreme Court Review of Race-Based Admissions
headline.print_headline: Colleges Brace for Uncertainty as Court Reviews Race in Admissions

snippet: After the Supreme Court said it would revisit an affirmative action case from Texas, colleges expressed concerns about the potential costs of having to replace programs to achieve diversity.
